IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: TO PROVIDE EXCEPTIONAL HEALTH CARE IN A RESPECTFUL, COMPASSIONATE, AND HEALING ENVIRONMENT.
IRS990.MissionDescription: MADISON COUNTY COMMUNITY HOSPITAL'S VISION IS TO BE THE HEALTH CARE PROVIDER OF CHOICE FOR THE PEOPLE WHO LIVE AND WORK IN MADISON COUNTY AND THE SURROUNDING AREA.

Form990ScheduleCPartIV.Explanation: A PERCENTAGE OF DUES PAID TO THE OHIO HOSPITAL ASSOCIATION AND THE AMERICAN HOSPITAL ASSOCIATION WERE ALLOCATED BY THE RESPECTIVE ORGANIZATIONS TO LOBBYING ACTIVITIES.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Identifier: DESCRIPTION OF UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS UNDER FIN 48:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: INCOME TAXES - THE HOSPITAL IS EXEMPT FROM INCOME TAXES UNDER SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE.
REVENUE REPORTED BY MADISON FAMILY HEALTH CORPORATION FORM 990 (EIN:31-1514418): $17,502
EXPENSES REPORTED BY MADISON FAMILY HEALTH CORPORATION FORM 990 (EIN:31-1514418): $5,472

Form990ScheduleHPartVI.Explanation: PART I, L7 COL(F): BAD DEBT EXPENSE OF $4,269,041 WAS EXCLUDED FROM LINE 7F.PART I, LINE 7: THE COST-TO-CHARGE RATIO WAS DERIVED FROM WORKSHEET 2, RATIO OF PATIENT CARE COST-TO-CHARGES.

PART II: OUR INVOLVEMENT IN ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT AND WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT KEEPS US IN TUNE WITH THE NEEDS OF THE COMMUNITY, INCLUDING THE HEALTHCARE NEEDS OF OUR POPULATION. OUR INVOLVEMENT ALLOWS US TO EDUCATE THE COMMUNITY ON LEADING HEALTH ISSUES AND ALLOWS THE COMMUNITY TO EDUCATE US ON THEIR PERSPECTIVES OF WHAT RESOURCES AND SERVICES ARE NEEDED TO MAKE THIS A HEALTHY AND VIBRANT COMMUNITY.

PART III, LINE 4: PATIENT ACCOUNTS RECEIVABLE - THE HOSPITAL REPORTS PATIENT ACCOUNTS RECEIVABLE FOR SERVICES RENDERED AT NET REALIZABLE AMOUNTS FROM PATIENTS, THIRD-PARTY PAYORS AND OTHERS. THE HOSPITAL PROVIDES AN ALLOWANCE FOR DOUBTFUL ACCOUNTS BASED UPON A REVIEW OF OUTSTANDING RECEIVABLES, HISTORICAL COLLECTION INFORMATION AND EXISTING ECONOMIC CONDITIONS. DELINQUENT RECEIVABLES ARE WRITTEN-OFF BASED ON INDIVIDUAL CREDIT EVALUATION AND SPECIFIC CIRCUMSTANCES OF THE PATIENT OR THIRD-PARTY PAYOR.

PART III, LINE 8: MEDICARE SHORTFALLS PRIMARILY BENEFIT THE ELDER MEMBERS OF OUR COMMUNITY, WHICH IS A GROWING DEMOGRAPHIC IN MADISON COUNTY. IF WE CHOOSE NOT TO PARTICIPATE IN THE MEDICARE PROGRAM, HEALTHCARE SERVICES WOULD HAVE TO BE OBTAINED FROM PROVIDERS LOCATED OUTSIDE OUR COMMUNITY, PLACING INCREASED COSTS AND STRESS ON THIS POPULATION. MEDICARE ALLOWABLE COSTS WERE TAKEN FROM INFORMATION OFF OF THE 2010 MEDICARE COST REPORT.

PART III, LINE 9B: MCCH INFORMS OHIO RESIDENTS, WHO ARE NOT RECIPIENTS OF THE MEDICAID PROGRAM, WHOSE GROSS INCOME IS AT OR BELOW THE FEDERAL POVERTY LEVEL OR WHOSE GROSS INCOME FALLS WITHIN THE MADISON COUNTY FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE SLIDING SCALE, OF THEIR RIGHT TO RECEIVE BASIC MEDICALLY NECESSARY HOSPITAL SERVICES AT NO COST OR AT A DISCOUNTED COST. ADDITIONALLY, THE HOSPITAL WILL MAKE THE HCAP CHARITY CARE AND THE COUNTY FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE APPLICATION PROCESS SYNONYMOUS, EASY TO UNDERSTAND, AND AVAILABLE TO ALL PATIENTS. NOTICES ARE POSTED IN REGISTRATION AREAS, THE EMERGENCY ROOM, THE CASHIER'S OFFICE, AND THE CUSTOMER SERVICE AREA SPECIFYING THE RIGHTS OF INDIVIDUALS WITH INCOMES AT OR BELOW THE FEDERAL POVERTY LEVEL TO RECEIVE, AT NO COST OR REDUCED COST, BASIC MEDICALLY NECESSARY HOSPITAL SERVICES. THE INCOME GUIDELINES AND A TELEPHONE NUMBER TO CALL FOR AN APPLICATION WILL BE PRINTED ON THE FRONT OF EACH MONTHLY STATEMENT.MCCH MAY DIRECT PATIENTS TO APPLY FOR MEDICAID, BUT WILL ACCEPT HCAP AND COUNTY FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE APPLICATIONS. APPLICANTS SHALL COOPERATE IN SUPPLYING INFORMATION ABOUT HEALTH INSURANCE OR MEDICAL BENEFITS AVAILABLE SO THE HOSPITAL MAY DETERMINE ANY POTENTIAL THIRD-PARTY RESOURCES THAT MAY BE AVAILABLE. A PATIENT WITH INSURANCE CANNOT BE CONSIDERED UNTIL ALL INSURANCE PAYMENTS HAVE BEEN MADE.THE FEDERAL INCOME POVERTY LEVEL GUIDELINES (FIPLG) ARE USED AS THE THRESHOLD TO DETERMINE INCOME ELIGIBILITY FOR HCAP CHARITY CARE AND THROUGH 400% OF THE FIPLG SHALL BE USED AS THE THRESHOLD TO DETERMINE INCOME ELIGIBILITY FOR THE MADISON COUNTY FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE PROGRAM. THE SCALE SHALL BE UPDATED ANNUALLY BASED ON CHANGES TO THE ANNUALLY UPDATED FIPLG.
PART V, SECTION B, LINE 19D: 20% DISCOUNT

PART VI, LINE 2: THE HOSPITAL WORKS WITH COMMUNITY LEADERS AND OTHER HEALTH ORGANIZATIONS IN OUR COMMUNITY TO DEVISE THE BEST WAYS TO PROVIDE THE HEALTH NEEDS OF OUR SERVICE AREA. HOSPITAL LEADERS PARTICIPATE IN LOCAL ORGANIZATIONS TO KEEP IN TOUCH WITH COMMUNITY NEEDS.

PART VI, LINE 3: THE HOSPITAL UTILIZES FINANCIAL COUNSELORS TO HELP PATIENTS DETERMINE IF THEY ARE ELIGIBLE FOR ANY FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE. OUR THIRD PARTY COLLECTION COMPANIES ARE MADE AWARE OF OUR CHARITY POLICIES AND HELP IDENTIFY PATIENTS IN NEED. THE PATIENT BILLING STATEMENTS INFORM PATIENTS IF THEY ARE UNABLE TO PAY THEIR BILL, THEY COULD QUALIFY FOR ASSISTANCE AND DIRECT CONTACT PHONE NUMBERS ARE PROVIDED. OUR WEBSITE ALSO INFORMS OUR PATIENTS OF AVAILABLE ASSISTANCE.

PART VI, LINE 4: MADISON COUNTY IS LOCATED IN WEST CENTRAL OHIO AND IS CONSIDERED PART OF THE COLUMBUS, OHIO METROPOLITAN STATISTICAL AREA. ITS COUNTY SEAT IS LONDON. MADISON COUNTY SPANS I-70 AND I-71 AS THEY CONVERGE ON COLUMBUS.AS OF THE CENSUS OF 2010, THERE WERE 43,435 PEOPLE, 14,533 HOUSEHOLDS AND 10,167 FAMILIES RESIDING IN THE COUNTY. THE RACIAL MAKEUP OF THE COUNTY WAS 90.9% WHITE, 6.2% AFRICAN AMERICAN, 0.4% NATIVE AMERICAN, 0.9% ASIAN, 0.4% FROM OTHER RACES, AND 1.2% FROM TWO OR MORE RACES. 1.0% OF THE POPULATION WAS HISPANIC OF ANY RACE.OF THE 14,533 HOUSEHOLDS, 71.8% WERE OWNER OCCUPIED WITH A MEDIAN HOUSE VALUE OF $144,200. 28.2% OF HOUSEHOLDS WERE RENTER OCCUPIED WITH A MEDIAN GROSS RENT OF $600. OF THE 10,167 FAMILIES, 31.5% WERE MARRIED COUPLES WITH OWN CHILDREN UNDER THE AGE 18, 4.9% WERE MALE HEADS OF HOUSHOLD WITH OWN CHILDREN, 8.4% WERE FEMALE HEADS OF HOUSEHOLD WITH OWN CHILDREN AND 55.2% WERE FAMILIES WITH NO OWN CHILDREN.IN THE COUNTY, THE POPULATION WAS SPREAD OUT WITH 22.8% UNDER THE AGE OF 18, 9.0% FROM 18 TO 24, 29.8% FROM 25 TO 44, 26.4% FROM 45 TO 64, AND 12.0% WHO WERE 65 YEARS OF AGE OR OLDER. THE MEDIAN AGE WAS 38.1 YEARS. THE MEDIAN INCOME FOR A HOUSEHOLD IN THE COUNTY WAS $53,041. 84.6% OF INDIVIDUALS 25 YEARS OR OLDER WERE HIGH SCHOOL GRADUATES OR BEYOND.

PART VI, LINE 6: MADISON COUNTY COMMUNITY HOSPITAL (MCCH) HAS AN OPEN MEDICAL STAFF. ALL PHYSICIANS IN THE COMMUNITY WHO MEET MEMBERSHIP AND CLINICAL PRIVILEGE REQUIREMENTS MAY PRACTICE AT MCCH. WE CURRENTLY HAVE PHYSICIANS ON STAFF FROM VARIOUS LOCATIONS IN OUR COMMUNITY INCLUDING LONDON, WEST JEFFERSON, SPRINGFIELD, AND COLUMBUS.OUR BOARD OF TRUSTEES IS COMPOSED OF COMMUNITY MEMBERS.MCCH IS THE ONLY HOSPITAL IN MADISON COUNTY. THE MCCH EMERGENCY DEPARTMENT IS STAFFED 24 HOURS A DAY, SEVEN DAYS A WEEK AND IS OPEN TO ALL PEOPLE REGARDLESS OF THEIR ABILITY TO PAY. THE NEAREST HOSPITAL TO MCCH IS ABOUT 20 MILES IN ALL DIRECTIONS. AS THE COMMUNITY'S SOLE PROVIDER, MCCH IS DEDICATED TO MAINTAINING SERVICES INCLUDING EMERGENCY CARE, MATERNITY CARE, AND BREAST CARE SERVICES.

PART VI, LINE 7: MCCH IS A PART OF THE OSU/MOUNT CARMEL HEALTH ALLIANCE. SINCE 1999 THE PARTNERSHIP WITH THESE TWO SYSTEMS THROUGH THE HEALTH ALLIANCE IS ALL ABOUT BUILDING BETTER HEALTH CARE IN MADISON COUNTY AND THE SURROUNDING COMMUNITIES. THROUGH THE ALLIANCE, WE CAN PROVIDE ADDITIONAL HEALTHCARE RESOURCES AND IMPROVED ACCESS TO SPECIALIZED MEDICAL SERVICES.

Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Explanation: THE MADISON COUNTY HOSPITAL EXECUTIVE BONUS PROGRAM AWARDS PAYMENT OF A BONUS BASED ON MEETING GOALS ESTABLISHED BY THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES. GOALS REFLECT THREE PRIMARY CRITERIA: FINANCIAL PERFORMANCE, CUSTOMER SERVICE, AND QUALITY. CURRENT YEAR EXECUTIVE BONUSES WERE ACCRUED AND WILL BE PAID IN 2011.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 6
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: MADISON COUNTY COMMUNITY HOSPITAL HAS TWO MEMBERS: MADISON COUNTY HOSPITAL, INC. AND HEALTH ALLIANCE OSU/MOUNT CARMEL.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7A
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: MADISON COUNTY COMMUNITY HOSPITAL HAS TWO MEMBERS: MADISON COUNTY HOSPITAL, INC. AND HEALTH ALLIANCE OSU/MOUNT CARMEL. BOTH MEMBERS OF MADISON COUNTY COMMUNITY HOSPITAL (MADISON COUNTY HOSPITAL, INC. AND HEALTH ALLIANCE OSU/MOUNT CARMEL) HAVE THE ABILITY TO APPOINT BOARD MEMBERS.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7B
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: BOTH MEMBERS OF MADISON COUNTY COMMUNITY HOSPITAL, (MADISON COUNTY HOSPITAL, INC. AND HEALTH ALLIANCE OSU/MOUNT CARMEL) HAVE THE ABILITY TO APPOINT BOARD MEMBERS AND APPROVE MAJOR POLICY DECISIONS. APPOINTMENT AND ELECTION TO THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES TAKES PLACE AT THE ANNUAL MEETING OF THE MEMBERS OR SPECIAL MEETING HELD FOR SUCH PURPOSE. MCH APPOINTS EIGHT TRUSTEES, WHICH TRUSTEES ORDINARILY ARE THE MEMBERS OF MCH'S BOARD OF TRUSTEES. OSU/MOUNT CARMEL APPOINTS FOUR TRUSTEES TO SERVE ON THE BOARD. MADISON COUNTY APPOINTS ONE TRUSTEE.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE FORM 990 WAS REVIEWED AT THE JUNE 29, 2011 FINANCE COMMITTEE MEETING. THE FORM 990 WILL BE MADE AVAILABLE IN JULY TO ALL FINANCE COMMITTEE MEMBERS (7 MEMBERS) ONLY BY WAY OF SECURED WEB PORTAL.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: ANNUALLY, THE CEO, MEMBERS OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES, ADMINISTRATIVE STAFF, DEPARTMENT MANAGEMENT STAFF, AND MEDICAL STAFF MEMBERS WITH ADMINISTRATIVE RESPONSIBILITIES, RECEIVE A COPY OF THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY. THEY ARE ASKED TO COMPLETE AND RETURN THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST AGREEMENT AND ANNUAL DISCLOSURE STATEMENT TO THE ADMINISTRATIVE OFFICE. THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST STATEMENTS ARE REVIEWED AND RETAINED ON FILE. ANY INTERESTS DISCLOSED ARE DEALT WITH APPROPRIATELY AS POTENTIAL CONFLICTS ARISE.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: COMPENSATION REVIEWS FOR THE CEO AND TOP MANAGEMENT OFFICIALS, OFFICERS AND KEY EMPLOYEES WERE CONDUCTED BY AN INDEPENDENT CONSULTING FIRM. COMPENSATION REVIEWS WERE PERFORMED IN 2007 AND 2010. COMPENSATION DID NOT CHANGE IN 2008 AND 2009. IN ADDITION, REGIONAL SALARY SURVEYS WERE UTILIZED IN THE REVIEW PROCESS.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION'S CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND GOVERNING DOCUMENTS ARE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990, PART VII, SECTION A, LINE 1A, COLUMN B:
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: FREDERICK L. KOLB AND MICHAEL S. BROWNING ON AVERAGE DEVOTED 40 HOURS TO MADISON COUNTY COMMUNITY HOSPITAL, 2 HOURS TO MADISON COUNTY HOSPITAL FOUNDATION, INC., 2 HOURS TO MADISON COUNTY HOSPITAL, INC., AND 2 HOURS TO MADISON FAMILY HEALTH CORPORATION.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: CHANGES IN NET ASSETS OR FUND BALANCES:

GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION'S FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AUDITED ON A CONSOLIDATED BASIS WITH ITS AFFILIATES, MADISON COUNTY HOSPITAL, INC., MADISON FAMILY HEALTH CORPORATION AND MADISON COUNTY HOSPITAL FOUNDATION, INC., BY AN INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTING FIRM. IN ADDITION, THE ORGANIZATION HAS A COMMITTEE THAT ASSUMES THE RESPONSIBILITY FOR OVERSIGHT OF THE AUDIT OF ITS FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND ITS SELECTION OF THE INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTANT. THIS PROCESS HAS NOT CHANGED FROM THE PRIOR YEAR.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990, PART III, STATEMENT OF PROGRAM SERVICE ACCOMPLISHMENTS:
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE VALUES OF MADISON COUNTY COMMUNITY HOSPITAL (MCCH) INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING: RESPECT FOR PEOPLE, STEWARDSHIP OF RESOURCES AND COMMITMENT TO EXCELLENCE. RESPECT FOR PEOPLE: MCCH TREATS EVERYONE WITH KINDNESS AND RESPECT. STEWARDSHIP OF RESOURCES: MCCH MANAGES THE RESOURCES ENTRUSTED TO THEM IN A RESPONSIBLE AND EFFECTIVE MANNER. COMMITMENT TO EXCELLENCE: MCCH CONTINUOUSLY STRIVES TO IMPROVE THEIR PERFORMANCE IN ALL AREAS, PROMOTE A CULTURE OF INTEGRITY AND HIGH ETHICAL STANDARDS, MAINTAIN THE HIGHEST STANDARDS OF PATIENT CARE AND UNDERSTAND AND MEET THE HEALTH CARE NEEDS OF THE COMMUNITIES SERVED BY MCCH. MCCH PROVIDES SERVICE TO ALL PERSONS WITHOUT REGARD TO RACE, COLOR, NATIONAL ORIGIN, DISABILITY, DIAGNOSIS, AGE OR ABILITY TO PAY. SINCE OPENING IN 1962, THEIR FAMILY-FRIENDLY SYSTEM HAS ENSURED THAT QUALITY HEALTH CARE IS AVAILABLE TO ALL WHO ENTER THEIR DOORS. WHILE MCCH CONSTANTLY STRIVES TO IMPROVE THEIR FACILITIES AND SERVICES, ONE GOAL REMAINS THE SAME: MCCH IS A COMMUNITY HOSPITAL WITH A COMMUNITY SPIRIT; A PLACE WHERE PATIENTS AND THEIR FAMILIES CAN COUNT ON PERSONAL CARE, CLOSE TO HOME. ABOUT MCCH: QUALITY CARE IS ABOUT MORE THAN THE SIZE OF A HOSPITAL. IT'S ABOUT CARING FOR PATIENTS WITH COMPETENCE, COMMITMENT, AND COMPASSION. AT MCCH, PATIENTS RECEIVE THE BEST POSSIBLE CARE FROM WELL-TRAINED PHYSICIANS AND EXPERIENCED, DEDICATED CAREGIVERS. THEIR FACILITIES ALLOW FOR A COMFORTABLE STAY, WHETHER PATIENTS ARE AT MCCH FOR A FEW HOURS, A FEW DAYS, OR AN EXTENDED TIME. THEIR STATE-OF-THE-ART EQUIPMENT, DIAGNOSTIC SERVICES, AND TREATMENT PROGRAMS HELP RESTORE PATIENTS TO GOOD HEALTH IN THE SHORTEST TIME POSSIBLE. ON NOVEMBER 1, 1999, MCCH FORMED A UNIQUE AFFILIATION WITH THE OSU/MOUNT CARMEL HEALTH ALLIANCE, EXPANDING THEIR RANGE OF SERVICES. THESE MEDICAL FAMILY TIES ALLOW MCCH TO PROVIDE PATIENTS EVEN MORE OF THE BEST QUALITY CARE, CLOSE TO HOME. MCCH'S TEAM OF CAREGIVERS MANAGES MORE THAN 50,000 PATIENT VISITS EACH YEAR, PROVIDING A BROAD RANGE OF HEALTH SERVICES. THESE SERVICES INCLUDE EXTENSIVE INPATIENT AND OUTPATIENT PROGRAMS, COMPREHENSIVE WOMEN'S HEALTH CARE RESOURCES, UP-TO-DATE IMAGING TECHNOLOGIES, AND EMERGENCY CARE. BEYOND THE MEDICAL EXPERTISE MCCH PROVIDES, THEY ARE ALSO PROUD TO BE PART OF THE COMMUNITY. PATIENTS SEE MCCH'S PHYSICIANS SITTING NEXT TO THEM IN CHURCH, THEIR NURSES SHOPPING AT THE GROCERY STORE AND THEIR STAFF MEMBERS PLAYING INTRAMURAL SOFTBALL. CARING FOR THE COMMUNITY IS MCCH'S BUSINESS, AND THE ONLY WAY TO DO IT WELL IS TO DO IT RIGHT. CARDIO-PULMONARY: CARDIOLOGISTS AT MCCH OFFER AN ARRAY OF TESTS AND PROCEDURES TO MAKE SURE THE PATIENT'S HEART IS HEALTHY AND TO FIND ANY POTENTIAL PROBLEMS BEFORE THEY BECOME LIFE THREATENING. MCCH'S CARDIOLOGISTS PROVIDE CONSULTATIONS TO DETERMINE THE BEST CARE FOR THEIR PATIENTS. CARDIOLOGY SERVICES INCLUDE: -ELECTROCARDIOGRAPHY (EKGS) -RHYTHM MONITORING -CARDIAC EVENT RECORDING -24-HOUR HALTER MONITORING -24-HOUR AMBULATORY BLOOD PRESSURE MONITORING -CARDIAC STRESS TESTING -HEAD-UP TILT TABLE TESTING -SIGNAL AVERAGED EKGS -ECHOCARDIOGRAPHY WITH 2-D COLOR FLOW DOPPLER RESPIRATORY THERAPY: RESPIRATORY THERAPY PROVIDES HELP FOR PATIENTS SUFFERING FROM MANY KINDS OF ILLNESSES AND INJURIES RELATED TO THE LUNGS INCLUDING PATIENTS SUFFERING FROM ASTHMA, BRONCHITIS, EMPHYSEMA, HEART FAILURE, PNEUMONIA, STROKE, SMOKE INHALATION, DROWNING, AND OTHER CONDITIONS. RESPIRATORY CARE INCLUDES DIAGNOSTIC EVALUATIONS TO FIND THE CAUSES OF BREATHING DISORDERS AND HOW TO CARE FOR THEM. MCCH'S THERAPISTS ALSO PROVIDE EDUCATION TO INFORM PATIENTS HOW TO USE BREATHING APPARATUS AND OTHER TOOLS TO HELP IMPROVE THEIR QUALITY OF LIFE. SLEEP LAB: A GOOD NIGHT'S REST CAN BE HARD TO ACHIEVE, ESPECIALLY FOR THE APPROXIMATELY 20 MILLION AMERICANS WHO SUFFER FROM SLEEP APNEA. SLEEP APNEA IS CHARACTERIZED BY BRIEF INTERRUPTION OF BREATHING DURING SLEEP. THE DISORDER IS A SERIOUS, POTENTIALLY LIFE-THREATENING CONDITION. FOR INDIVIDUALS WHO THINK THEY MIGHT HAVE SLEEP APNEA, THE MCCH SLEEP DISORDERS CENTER IS THERE TO HELP. THE HOSPITAL SLEEP LAB TESTS FOR TWO TYPES OF SLEEP APNEA: CENTRAL APNEA, WHICH OCCURS IN ROUGHLY 20 PERCENT OF APNEA PATIENTS, AND OBSTRUCTIVE SLEEP APNEA, THE MORE COMMON OF THE TWO CONDITIONS. THE ONLY WAY TO DIAGNOSE SLEEP APNEA IS THROUGH A SPECIALIZED TEST KNOWN AS A POLYSOMNOGRAPHY OR SLEEP STUDY. THE TESTING PROCESS IS SIMPLE. ANYONE WHO SUSPECTS THEY HAVE SLEEP APNEA, OR HAS A BED PARTNER WHO HAS NOTICED SNORING AND BREATHING IRREGULARITIES, IS ASKED TO CONSULT THEIR PHYSICIAN. THE DOCTOR THEN REFERS THE PATIENT TO THE HOSPITAL FOR A SLEEP STUDY. ONCE THE REFERRAL IS MADE, A MEMBER OF THE SLEEP CENTER STAFF CONTACTS THE PATIENT BY PHONE TO CONDUCT A PRE-SLEEP STUDY QUESTIONNAIRE. THE STAFF MEMBER EXPLAINS WHAT TO EXPECT OF THE TEST, WHAT TO WEAR AND ASKS IF THE PATIENT HAS SPECIAL REQUESTS. FOR INSTANCE, SOME INDIVIDUALS MAY WANT TO BRING THEIR PILLOW FROM HOME OR HAVE A RADIO OR FAN RUNNING WHILE THEY SLEEP. THE CENTER DOES ITS BEST TO SIMULATE THE PATIENT'S NORMAL SLEEPING ENVIRONMENT. THE TEST REQUIRES JUST ONE NIGHT OF SLEEP FROM THE PATIENT, COMPRISED OF SIX TO EIGHT HOURS. A TECHNICIAN MONITORS THE INDIVIDUAL FROM THE ROOM NEXT DOOR. IN THE MORNING, THE PATIENT IS RELEASED AND THE DATA COLLECTED THE NIGHT BEFORE IS INTERPRETED BY A PULMONOLOGIST OR NEUROLOGIST. THE RESULTS ARE SENT TO THE PATIENT'S PHYSICIAN, WHO THEN EXPLAINS TREATMENT OPTIONS SHOULD THE DIAGNOSIS BE CONFIRMED. FOR PATIENTS WITH CENTRAL APNEA, MEDICATION IS THE MOST OFTEN PRESCRIBED TREATMENT. FOR THOSE WITH OBSTRUCTIVE APNEA, MORE OPTIONS ARE AVAILABLE. WEIGHT LOSS COULD REDUCE THE FREQUENCY AND/OR INTENSITY OF THE EPISODES. ALSO, SURGERY CAN REMOVE SOFT TISSUE AT THE BACK OF THE THROAT THAT RESTRICTS NIGHT-TIME BREATHING. THE MOST COMMON METHOD OF TREATMENT IS A CONTINUOUS POSITIVE AIRWAY PRESSURE DEVICE (CPAP). THE DEVICE IS THE SIZE OF A SMALL RADIO AND SITS ON THE BEDSIDE TABLE. THE PATIENT WEARS A MASK OVER THE NOSE CONNECTED TO THE CPAP BY A HOSE. THE MACHINE FORCES AIR INTO THE PATIENT TO KEEP THE THROAT'S SOFT TISSUE OPEN. THOUGH IT SOUNDS UNCOMFORTABLE, MOST PATIENTS ADAPT QUICKLY AND PREFER THE GOOD NIGHT'S SLEEP OVER ANY INCONVENIENCE THE CPAP MIGHT CAUSE. WELLNESS CENTER: LIVING AND ENJOYING LIFE TO THE FULLEST ARE KEY COMPONENTS OF A HEALTHY LIFESTYLE. FITNESS IS A WAY OF LIFE THAT ALLOWS EVERYONE TO FUNCTION AND PERFORM AT THEIR BEST. IT'S A HARMONIC BALANCE OF PRESCRIBED EXERCISE, EATING HABITS AND PREVENTATIVE HEALTH CARE. THE WELLNESS CENTER IS DESIGNED TO IMPROVE AEROBIC EFFICIENCY, MUSCULAR ENDURANCE AND BODY COMPOSITION THROUGH THE USE OF TREADMILLS, STATIONARY BIKES, A STAIR CLIMBER AND STRENGTH-TRAINING EQUIPMENT. ONCOLOGY/CHEMOTHERAPY: MCCH OFFERS CANCER TREATMENT SERVICES INCLUDING DIAGNOSIS, SURGERY, AND CHEMOTHERAPY. ONCOLOGY PATIENTS AT MCCH HAVE ACCESS TO THE MOST ADVANCED TREATMENT OPTIONS AVAILABLE ANYWHERE. THROUGH MCCH'S PARTNERSHIP WITH THE ZANGMEISTER CENTER IN COLUMBUS, MCCH CONTINUES TO DEVELOP MORE SERVICES RELATED TO CANCER CARE, INCLUDING CLINICAL TRIALS. MCCH'S DIRECTOR OF ONCOLOGY SERVICES, DR. TAREK CHIDIAC, IS BOARD CERTIFIED IN BOTH ONCOLOGY AND HEMATOLOGY. HE OFFERS TREATMENTS FOR BLOOD DISORDERS (HEMATOLOGY) SUCH AS ANEMIA, HEMOPHILIA, AND SICKLE CELL IN ADDITION TO ONCOLOGY SERVICES. PEDIATRIC REHABILITATION SERVICES: THE PEDIATRIC REHABILITATION PROGRAM HAS BEEN DESIGNED TO SPECIFICALLY TREAT CHILDREN (AGES BIRTH TO 21 YEARS OF AGE) WITH A VARIETY OF NEUROLOGICAL, DEVELOPMENTAL AND REHABILITATIVE ISSUES. MCCH'S OUTPATIENT PEDIATRIC REHABILITATION TEAM CONSISTS OF A WIDE RANGE OF SPECIALISTS TO HELP YOUR CHILD ACHIEVE MAXIMUM INDEPENDENCE: PHYSICAL THERAPISTS, OCCUPATIONAL THERAPISTS AND SPEECH AND LANGUAGE PATHOLOGIST. PEDIATRIC REHABILITATION IS NEEDED IN ORDER FOR CHILDREN TO GAIN/REGAIN FUNCTIONAL INDEPENDENCE. FOR SOME CHILDREN, THERAPY IS NEEDED TO IMPROVE JOINT RANGE OF MOTION OR STRENGTHENING. FOR MANY PATIENTS, THERAPY INVOLVES WORKING ON DEVELOPMENTAL SKILLS, I.E. ROLLING, SITTING, CRAWLING, WALKING, AND JUMPING. MCCH UTILIZES CREATIVE PLAY TO ENHANCE AN ATMOSPHERE OF FUN, MOTIVATING THE CHILD TO ACQUIRE THE SKILLS NEEDED TO IMPROVE HIS OR HER ENVIRONMENT. ADULT OUTPATIENT REHABILITATION SERVICES: OUTPATIENT REHABILITATION AT MCCH PROVIDES A WIDE RANGE OF SERVICES TO HELP PEOPLE REGAIN THEIR HIGHEST LEVEL OF FUNCTION. WHETHER THE PATIENT IS RECOVERING FROM AN INJURY OR ILLNESS, OR JUST NEEDS ASSISTANCE WITH THE CHALLENGES OF DAILY LIFE, MCCH'S REHAB SERVICES TEAM WORKS WITH INDIVIDUALS TO MAXIMIZE THEIR ABILITIES.

OCCUPATIONAL THERAPY: THE GOAL OF OCCUPATIONAL THERAPY IS TO RESTORE FUNCTION TO THE BEST OF EACH PATIENT'S ABILITY. OCCUPATIONAL THERAPY ENABLES MCCH'S PATIENTS TO GAIN SATISFACTION AND INDEPENDENCE BY PERFORMING ACTIVITIES OF DAILY LIVING - WORK, PLAY OR SELF-CARE - FOR THEMSELVES. MCCH'S DEDICATED TEAM OF PROFESSIONALS STRIVES TO HELP PATIENTS IMPROVE CIRCULATION, RESTORE MOTION, STRENGTHEN THEIR UPPER BODY, RELIEVE PAIN, AND CORRECT AND PREVENT DEFORMITY. MCCH'S OCCUPATIONAL THERAPY STAFF CAN DESIGN CUSTOM SPLINTING, RECOMMEND ADAPTIVE EQUIPMENT, AND WORK TO RESTORE PSYCHOLOGICAL, PHYSICAL AND COGNITIVE INDEPENDENCE. MCCH'S OCCUPATIONAL THERAPY STAFF CAN HELP PATIENTS WITH VARIOUS CHALLENGES, GUIDING THEM THROUGH ACTIVITIES SUCH AS EXERCISE, SPLINTING, BATHING, DRESSING AND COOKING. COMMON PROBLEMS TREATED WITH OCCUPATIONAL THERAPY: -CARPAL TUNNEL SYNDROME -STROKE -HAND INJURIES -BRAIN INJURIES -DEVELOPMENTAL DELAYS -SPLINT & ADAPTIVE EQUIPMENT NEEDS -ENERGY CONSERVATION/JOINT PROTECTION -NEUROLOGICAL IMPAIRMENTS -URINARY INCONTINENCE PHYSICAL THERAPY AND SPORTS MEDICINE: PHYSICAL THERAPY PROMOTES HEALING AND ASSISTS PATIENTS TO REGAIN MOVEMENT, AND RESTORE FUNCTION TO AN INJURED BODY PART. MCCH'S THERAPISTS ALSO AID IN REBUILDING A PATIENT'S CONFIDENCE AND RELIEVING PAIN AND DISCOMFORT WHILE WORKING TOWARD RECOVERY. COMMON PROBLEMS TREATED WITH PHYSICAL THERAPY: -ORTHOPEDIC INJURIES -SPORTS INJURIES -BACK INJURIES/PAIN -NECK PAIN/INJURIES -STROKE -NEUROLOGICAL IMPAIRMENTS -BALANCE DEFICITS -DEVELOPMENTAL DELAYS -PAIN DURING OR AFTER PREGNANCY TREATMENT MAY INCLUDE TECHNIQUES TO DECREASE PAIN AND SWELLING, AS WELL AS EXERCISES TO INCREASE STRENGTH AND MOBILITY. OTHER TREATMENTS INCLUDE THERAPEUTIC EXERCISE, PELVIC OR CERVICAL TRACTION, ELECTRICAL STIMULATION ULTRASOUND, WOUND CARE, GAIT TRAINING, MANUAL THERAPY AND MASSAGE. MCCH'S TREATMENT IS NOT ALL PHYSICAL. EDUCATION ON TOPICS LIKE JOINT PROTECTION, BACK SAFETY, BODY MECHANICS, POSTURE EDUCATION, AND HOME EXERCISE INSTRUCTION ALSO PLAY A ROLE IN THE RECOVERY PROCESS. THEIR STAFF PLANS FOR THE NEEDS OF PATIENTS UPON DISCHARGE, AND PROVIDES A CONTINUUM OF CARE. MCCH'S SPORTS MEDICINE PROGRAM PROVIDES CARE FOR ALL SPORTS RELATED INJURIES AND HELPS TO IMPROVE ATHLETIC PERFORMANCE. WHATEVER THE PATIENTS SPORT, HAVING THE MCCH SPORTS MEDICINE STAFF ROOTING FOR THE PATIENT CAN HELP THEM MAKE THE MOST OF THEIR ATHLETIC ABILITIES. SPEECH THERAPY: SPEECH THERAPY PROVIDES A WIDE RANGE OF SERVICES TO PATIENTS WHO EXHIBIT DIFFICULTY WITH COMMUNICATION. SUCH DIFFICULTIES MAY RESULT FROM: -STROKE -HEAD INJURY -PROGRESSIVE DISEASE -CANCER -VOCAL ABUSE OR MISUSE -DEVELOPMENTAL DELAYS -MENTAL RETARDATION -AUTISM WOMEN'S HEALTH: WOMEN'S HEALTH ISSUES CAN BE WIDE-RANGING, CONFUSING AND SOMETIMES FRIGHTENING, WHICH IS WHY MCCH OFFERS A LITTLE EXTRA TLC DURING THE PATIENT'S VISIT. WHETHER THE PATIENT HAS QUESTIONS ABOUT PREGNANCY, MAMMOGRAMS, OR MENOPAUSE, THEIR STAFF OF WOMEN'S HEALTH EXPERTS WILL HELP PATIENTS FIND THE ANSWERS. AT MCCH THE PATIENT IS MORE THAN A PATIENT. THE PATIENTS ARE MCCH'S PARTNERS IN CARING FOR THEIR BODY AND THEIR HEALTH. THROUGH COMMUNICATION BETWEEN PATIENTS AND THEIR CAREGIVERS, MCCH'S COMPASSIONATE MEDICAL TEAM FOSTERS A PARTNERSHIP DESIGNED TO HELP THE PATIENT TAKE CONTROL OF THEIR HEALTH. OBSTETRICS AND GYNECOLOGY: AT OBSTETRICS & GYNECOLOGY OF LONDON, INC., CONVENIENTLY LOCATED AT 54 WEST HIGH STREET, MCCH RECOGNIZES THAT WOMEN'S HEALTH CARE NEEDS ARE SPECIAL AND COMPLEX. THE PATIENT'S WELL-BEING IS THE MAIN FOCUS OF THE MEDICAL PRACTICE. WOMEN EXPERIENCE MANY UNIQUE CHANGES THROUGHOUT LIFE WHICH AFFECT REPRODUCTIVE, SEXUAL, AND OVERALL GENERAL HEALTH. MCCH'S STAFF WILL PROVIDE YOU WITH THE BEST HEALTH CARE AVAILABLE TO MANAGE THE CHANGING NEEDS OF YOUR BODY. WOMEN OF ALL AGES CAN EXPERIENCE THE FOLLOWING SERVICES IN THE MOST EASILY ACCESSIBLE, TECHNOLOGICALLY-ADVANCED MADISON COUNTY LOCATION FOR WOMEN'S HEALTH CARE: -ANNUAL EXAMS -OBSTETRICAL CARE -FAMILY PLANNING -INFERTILITY -ULTRASOUND -GYNECOLOGICAL SURGERY -PMS DISORDERS -MENOPAUSE -LASER SURGERY -URINARY INCONTINENCE -ADVANCED ENDOSCOPY -BONE DENSITOMETRY* -MAMMOGRAPHY* *SERVICE CONDUCTED AT THE BATTELLE BREAST CARE CENTER LOCATED IN THE PARK AVENUE MEDICAL BUILDING. BONE DENSITOMETRY AND OSTEOPOROSIS: OSTEOPOROSIS IS A POTENTIALLY CRIPPLING DISEASE CHARACTERIZED BY THE LOSS OF BONE TISSUE AND A SUSCEPTIBILITY TO FRACTURE. IT AFFLICTS AN ESTIMATED 25 MILLION AMERICANS, 80 PERCENT OF WHOM ARE WOMEN. OSTEOPOROSIS IS OFTEN CALLED THE "SILENT DISEASE" BECAUSE IT DOES NOT PRODUCE ANY SYMPTOMS UNTIL A FRACTURE OCCURS. APPROXIMATELY 50 PERCENT OF WOMEN OVER THE AGE OF 50 ARE AT RISK OF SUSTAINING AN OSTEOPOROTIC FRACTURE. TODAY, DOCTORS ARE BETTER EQUIPPED TO DETECT AND TREAT BONE LOSS IN ITS EARLIEST STAGES, SO AS TO PREVENT THE DISEASE OR LESSEN ITS IMPACT. ALSO, SEVERAL DRUG THERAPIES NOW ON THE MARKET HAVE BEEN SHOWN TO BE CLINICALLY EFFECTIVE IN SLOWING DOWN OR REVERSING THE BONE-LOSS PROCESS. JUST AS NO PHYSICIAN WOULD PRESCRIBE A MEDICATION FOR HYPERTENSION WITHOUT FIRST TAKING THE PATIENT'S BLOOD PRESSURE, THE DIAGNOSIS AND TREATMENT OF OSTEOPOROSIS SHOULD BEGIN WITH A MEASUREMENT OF THE PATIENT'S BONE MASS OR BONE DENSITY. BONE DENSITOMETRY USES AN ADVANCED TECHNOLOGY CALLED DUAL-ENERGY X-RAY ABSORPTIOMETRY (DXA) TO SAFELY, ACCURATELY, AND PAINLESSLY MEASURE BONE DENSITY AND THE MINERAL CONTENT OF BONE. DURING A COMPREHENSIVE BONE EVALUATION WITH DXA, THE PATIENT LIES COMFORTABLY STILL ON A PADDED TABLE WHILE THE DXA UNIT SCANS ONE OR MORE AREAS, USUALLY FRACTURE-PRONE AREAS SUCH AS THE SPINE OR HIP. RADIATION EXPOSURE DURING BONE DENSITOMETRY IS LESS THAN THE RADIATION EXPOSURE DURING A COAST-TO-COAST AIRLINE FLIGHT. THE ENTIRE PROCESS TAKES ONLY A FEW MINUTES TO COMPLETE, DEPENDING ON THE NUMBER OF SITES SCANNED. IT INVOLVES NO INJECTIONS OR INVASIVE PROCEDURES, AND PATIENTS REMAIN FULLY CLOTHED. A REPORT WILL BE SENT TO THE PATIENTS DOCTOR THAT CONSISTS OF THEIR DENSITY MEASUREMENTS AND RECOMMENDATIONS FOR TREATMENT OR PREVENTION OF OSTEOPOROSIS AND BONE LOSS. DIGITAL MAMMOGRAPHY AT THE BATTELLE BREAST CARE CENTER: STATISTICS SHOW THAT ONE OUT OF EVERY EIGHT WOMEN WILL GET BREAST CANCER SOMETIME IN HER LIFETIME. THAT IS WHY DOING EVERYTHING A WOMAN CAN TO DETECT PROBLEMS EARLY IS SO IMPORTANT. WIDESPREAD USE OF REGULAR SCREENING MAMMOGRAPHY HAS CONTRIBUTED TO RECENT IMPROVEMENTS IN THE BREAST CANCER SURVIVAL RATE. THE SUCCESS RATE FOR TREATING BREAST CANCER IS 98 PERCENT IF THE DISEASE IS CAUGHT IN ITS EARLIEST STAGE. THE GE HEALTHCARE SENOGRAPHE DIGITAL MAMMOGRAPHY SYSTEM PROVIDES PHYSICIANS WITH CLEAR AND PRECISE ALL-DIGITAL IMAGES, RATHER THAN IMAGES ON X-RAY FILM. THERE ARE MANY ADVANTAGES TO A DIGITAL SYSTEM. AS OPPOSED TO X-RAYS, THE IMAGES ARE CLEAR AND EASY TO READ. DIGITAL MAMMOGRAPHY OFFERS A BETTER VIEW OF THE BREAST, ESPECIALLY NEAR THE SKIN LINE, CHEST WALL AND IN WOMEN WITH DIVERSE BREAST TISSUE TYPES. THE DIGITAL IMAGE IS READY TO READ WITHIN 10 SECONDS - THERE IS NO LONGER A WAIT FOR FILMS TO BE DEVELOPED TO BE SURE THE IMAGES ARE USABLE. DIGITAL MAMMOGRAMS TAKE AS LITTLE AS HALF THE TIME OF TRADITIONAL FILM MAMMOGRAMS. IF A SECOND OPINION IS NEEDED, THE IMAGE CAN BE SENT ELECTRONICALLY TO A CONSULTING PHYSICIAN VIRTUALLY INSTANTANEOUSLY. MAMMOGRAMS ARE RECOMMENDED ANNUALLY FOR WOMEN ABOVE THE AGE OF 40 AND SOMETIMES FOR WOMEN YOUNGER THAN 40 WHO HAVE HIGH RISK FACTORS, SUCH AS A FAMILY HISTORY OF BREAST CANCER. THE HIGHEST INSTANCES OF BREAST CANCER OCCUR IN WOMEN OVER 50, BUT THE TYPES OF CANCERS THAT OCCUR IN THE OLDER AGE GROUPS ARE USUALLY SLOWER GROWING, SO THE SURVIVAL RATE AMONG THESE WOMEN IS GREATER, ESPECIALLY WHEN CAUGHT EARLY.

EMERGENCY DEPARTMENT SERVICES: THE MADISON COUNTY HOSPITAL EMERGENCY DEPARTMENT, STAFFED BY A QUALIFIED, CARING TEAM OF PHYSICIANS AND NURSES, IS AVAILABLE 24 HOURS A DAY, SEVEN DAYS A WEEK, TO PROVIDE THE PATIENT URGENT MEDICAL ATTENTION. MCCH'S MEDICAL TEAM IS LINKED WITH THE PRIMARY LEVEL I TRAUMA CENTER IN CENTRAL OHIO THROUGH MCCH'S AFFILIATION WITH THE OSU/MOUNT CARMEL HEALTH ALLIANCE. IF A PATIENT'S HEALTH SITUATION REQUIRES ADVANCED SPECIALIZED CARE, MCCH'S MEDICAL TEAM CAN STABILIZE THE PATIENT'S CONDITION FOR A SAFE AIR OR GROUND TRANSPORT BY MED FLIGHT OF OHIO. VISITING THE EMERGENCY DEPARTMENT PRIOR TO SUCH A TRANSFER ENSURES THE PATIENT'S SAFEST AND QUICKEST RECOVERY. MCCH'S EMERGENCY DEPARTMENT OFFERS 11 BEDS IN THEIR STATE-OF-THE-ART FACILITY. MEDICAL DIRECTOR JORNEL RIVERA, D.O., WAS NAMED PREMIER MEDICAL CARE'S 2000 EMERGENCY PHYSICIAN OF THE YEAR. PREMIER IS A PRIVATE COMPANY THAT MANAGES AND STAFFS EMERGENCY DEPARTMENTS ACROSS THE UNITED STATES. OTHER PATIENT SERVICES - DIABETIC SERVICES: DIABETES IS A CHRONIC DISORDER THAT AFFECTS MILLIONS OF AMERICANS WITH VARYING DEGREES OF SEVERITY. THE POTENTIAL FOR SERIOUS COMPLICATIONS EXISTS IF GOOD BLOOD SUGAR CONTROL IS NOT MAINTAINED. THE DIABETIC RESOURCE STAFF AT MCCH WORKS WITH PATIENTS TO INFORM THEM OF WAYS TO MAINTAIN THEIR HEALTH AND AVOID THE COMPLICATIONS ASSOCIATED WITH DIABETES. DIETICIAN: WHETHER RECOVERING FROM AN INJURY OR ILLNESS OR LOOKING TO IMPROVE YOUR QUALITY OF LIFE, MCCH WORKS TO HELP THE PATIENTS GET BACK ON THE ROAD TO A HEALTHY LIFESTYLE. GOOD NUTRITION IS AN IMPORTANT PART OF THAT JOURNEY. WITH THE HELP OF OUR REGISTERED DIETITIAN, MCCH HELPS DEVELOP A DIETARY PROGRAM THAT ACCOMPLISHES INDIVIDUAL'S GOALS - FROM WEIGHT LOSS, WEIGHT GAIN, OR THE NUTRITIONAL MANAGEMENT OF MEDICAL CONDITIONS LIKE DIABETES OR HEART DISEASE. HOME DELIVERED MEALS (MEALS ON WHEELS): MCCH AND LIFE CARE ALLIANCE HAVE PARTNERED TO PROVIDE MEALS ON WHEELS SERVICES THROUGHOUT MADISON COUNTY. THE MEALS-ON-WHEELS PROGRAM PROVIDES HOME-DELIVERED MEALS FOR PEOPLE OVER THE AGE OF 60 WHO ARE UNABLE TO PREPARE HOT NUTRITIOUS MEALS FOR THEMSELVES. VOLUNTEERS DELIVER MEALS MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY. THOSE WHO QUALIFY FOR THE PROGRAM MAY CHOOSE TO ENROLL IN THE HOME-DELIVERED MEAL PROGRAM, OR DINE AT CONGREGATE SITES IN SOUTH SOLON, WEST JEFFERSON, OR MOUNT STERLING. LABORATORY: MANY OF MCCH'S LABORATORY TESTS ARE COMPLETED HERE IN THEIR OWN HOSPITAL LABORATORY. THE MAIN HOSPITAL LABORATORY IS STAFFED 24 HOURS A DAY/7 DAYS A WEEK WITH NO APPOINTMENT NECESSARY FOR OUTPATIENT LABORATORY WORK. INSURANCE IS ACCEPTED. THE OUTPATIENT LAB IS LOCATED IN THE PARK AVENUE MEDICAL BUILDING AND IS OPEN FROM 7 AM UNTIL 5 PM ON WEEKDAYS. THE MCCH LAB CAN PERFORM LABORATORY WORK ORDERED BY ANY PHYSICIAN, NOT JUST THOSE ON MCCH STAFF. IN COLLABORATION WITH OCCUPATIONAL HEALTH, THE LABORATORY PROVIDES A VARIETY OF OCCUPATIONAL DRUG SCREENING CHOICES INCLUDING TESTING, ACTING AS A COLLECTION SITE, BREATH ALCOHOL TESTING AND PROVIDING MRO SERVICES, IF NECESSARY. OCCUPATIONAL HEALTH: MCCH OCCUPATIONAL HEALTH SERVICES WORKS WITH MANY LOCAL EMPLOYERS AND PROVIDES SERVICES SUCH AS DRUG SCREENS, EMPLOYEE PHYSICALS, HEALTH EDUCATION AND TREATMENT OF WORK-RELATED INJURIES. THEY ALSO COORDINATE SERVICES FOR INJURED EMPLOYEES AND MANAGE THE FOLLOW-UP REQUIRED ON WORKERS' COMPENSATION CASES. THEY WORK CLOSELY WITH THE MCCH STAFF IN THEIR LABORATORY, AND PHYSICAL AND OCCUPATIONAL THERAPY DEPARTMENT TO PROVIDE THE NECESSARY TREATMENT. OTHER SERVICES THAT MCCH CAN PROVIDE INCLUDE: -REFERRALS FOR SPECIALTY EVALUATIONS -RETURN TO WORK INSTRUCTIONS -ON-SITE CONSULTATIONS AND SERVICES -IMMUNIZATIONS -COMPLETE LABORATORY SERVICES -PULMONARY FUNCTION TESTING -RESPIRATORY CLEARANCE EXAMINATIONS -DOT EXAMINATIONS -BREATH ALCOHOL TESTING PATIENT CARE UNITS: MCCH PROVIDES PATIENT UNITS DEDICATED TO SPECIFIC CARE NEEDS. THE INPATIENT CARE UNIT SERVES PATIENTS WHO ARE BEING TREATED FOR ILLNESSES AND INJURIES THAT REQUIRE CONSTANT CARE. THE MATERNITY UNIT PROVIDES CARE FOR NEW FAMILIES IN A NON-INVASIVE, FAMILY FRIENDLY ATMOSPHERE. THE INTENSIVE CARE UNIT PROVIDES CARE TO PATIENTS WHO REQUIRE ACUTE SERVICES. MCCH'S TEAM OF DOCTORS AND NURSES PROVIDE CONSTANT CARE TO STABILIZE AND IMPROVE THE PATIENT'S CONDITION. RADIOLOGY: MCCH'S RADIOLOGY DEPARTMENT OFFERS A WIDE RANGE OF SERVICES, INCLUDING SPECIALTY SERVICES. THEY PROVIDE DIAGNOSTIC OUTPATIENT, INPATIENT, AND EMERGENCY ROOM X-RAYS, INCLUDING FLUOROSCOPIC PROCEDURES SUCH AS UPPER GI'S AND BARIUM ENEMAS. UROLOGICAL PROCEDURES SUCH AS AN IVP OR KIDNEY X-RAYS CAN ALSO BE PERFORMED. MCCH SPECIALTY SERVICES INCLUDE: CT SCAN, ULTRASOUND, NUCLEAR MEDICINE, DIGITAL MAMMOGRAPHY, BONE DENSITOMETRY, MRI, AND BREAST MRI. SOCIAL SERVICES: MEDICAL SOCIAL WORKERS ARE ASSIGNED TO EACH PATIENT CARE AREA AND ARE TRAINED TO HELP PATIENTS AND FAMILY MEMBERS DEAL WITH FINANCIAL, SOCIAL AND EMOTIONAL PROBLEMS THAT RELATE TO A PATIENT'S ILLNESS OR HOSPITALIZATION. MEMBERS OF THE DEPARTMENT WORK WITH PATIENTS AND FAMILIES TO HELP DEAL WITH LONG-TERM ILLNESSES AND REHABILITATION. THEY ARE ALSO INVOLVED IN THE DISCHARGE PLANNING PROCESS. ULTRASOUND: ULTRASOUND IS A TECHNIQUE BY WHICH SOUND WAVES ARE BOUNCED INTO YOUR BODY, AND THEIR REFLECTIONS CAPTURED BY A MACHINE, TRANSFORMING THEM INTO AN IMAGE. ULTRASOUND DOES NOT INVOLVE RADIATION AND DOES NOT USE DYES THAT NEED TO BE INJECTED OR SWALLOWED. ULTRASOUND TESTS ARE USED IN DIAGNOSING AND TREATING A VARIETY OF HEALTH ISSUES, INCLUDING HEART CONDITIONS, MUSCLE PAIN, ABDOMINAL CONDITIONS, THYROID CONDITIONS, PREGNANCY, AND MANY OTHERS. VASCULAR LABORATORY: THE VASCULAR LABORATORY CONDUCTS TESTS RELATED TO ARTERY AND VEIN CONDITIONS. TESTS CAN BE CONDUCTED TO DETERMINE IF OBSTRUCTIONS OF THE VEINS OR ARTERIES EXIST. THESE TESTS ARE USED TO DIAGNOSE ANEURYSMS AND DISEASES OF THE ARTERIES. THE VASCULAR LAB ALSO HAS COLOR FLOW DUPLEX IMAGING (CDI) TECHNOLOGY. CDI IS USED TO EVALUATE VEINS FOR USE AS A GRAFT, OR TO DIAGNOSE VARICOSE VEINS AND VALVULAR INCOMPETENCY. SURGERY: EVERYONE GETS A LITTLE NERVOUS WHEN FACED WITH SURGERY. BUT PATIENTS CAN HAVE CONFIDENCE THAT THE SURGICAL TEAMS AT MCCH MEET THE HIGHEST STANDARDS AND ARE COMMITTED TO EXCELLENCE. THE HOSPITAL'S HUX SURGERY CENTER FEATURES THREE STATE-OF-THE-ART SURGICAL SUITES THAT CAN ACCOMMODATE ALL TYPES OF SURGERIES, INCLUDING TOTAL JOINT REPLACEMENT. MCCH'S SURGEONS USE THE LATEST LASER AND MICROSURGICAL INSTRUMENTS, AND PATIENTS RECOVER IN A COMFORTABLE RECOVERY ROOM. WITH NEW TECHNOLOGICAL ADVANCES IN SURGICAL PROCEDURES, MANY OPERATIONS THAT USED TO REQUIRE A STAY IN THE HOSPITAL CAN NOW BE DONE ON AN OUTPATIENT BASIS. WHEN SURGERY IS A CHOICE A PATIENT HAS TO MAKE, THE PATIENT CAN BE ASSURED THAT THE SURGERY CENTER AT MCCH PROVIDES THE MOST ADVANCED TREATMENTS AND TECHNOLOGY AVAILABLE ANYWHERE AND THE BEST CARE FOR YOU, CLOSE TO HOME. SURGICAL SPECIALTIES: MCCH HAS AN OUTSTANDING GROUP OF SURGEONS WHO SPECIALIZE IN THE FIELDS OF: -BREAST SURGERY -COSMETIC & RECONSTRUCTIVE -EAR, NOSE & THROAT -ENDOSCOPY -GENERAL SURGERY -OBSTETRICS & GYNECOLOGY -ORTHOPEDICS -OPHTHALMOLOGY -PODIATRY -UROLOGY -VASCULAR SURGERY UROLOGY: UROLOGY IS A SURGICAL SPECIALTY THAT DEALS WITH DISEASES OF THE MALE AND FEMALE URINARY TRACT AND THE MALE REPRODUCTIVE ORGANS. ALTHOUGH UROLOGY IS CLASSIFIED AS A SURGICAL SPECIALTY, THE UROLOGIST, BECAUSE OF THE WIDE VARIETY OF CLINICAL PROBLEMS ENCOUNTERED, REQUIRES KNOWLEDGE OF INTERNAL MEDICINE, PEDIATRICS, GYNECOLOGY, AND OTHER SPECIALTIES. ONE OF THE LATEST INNOVATIONS IN THE TREATMENT OF KIDNEY STONES IS AVAILABLE AT MCCH. HOLMIUM LASER LITHOTRIPSY IS THE MOST COST AND TIME EFFICIENT METHOD OF DEFINITIVE TREATMENT FOR PATIENTS WITH STONES IN THEIR KIDNEYS OR GREETERS. THE PROCEDURE USES A LASER TO BREAK THE STONE INTO DUST-LIKE GRANULES OF SAND. THE OUTPATIENT PROCEDURE LASTS FROM ABOUT 30 MINUTES TO TWO HOURS, DEPENDING ON THE SIZE AND LOCATION OF THE STONE AND RECOVERY TIME IS MINIMAL. THE HOLMIUM LASER PROCEDURE AND THE RANGE OF UROLOGY SERVICES AT MCCH MEANS PATIENTS RECEIVE THE MOST ADVANCED TREATMENT AND TECHNOLOGY AVAILABLE ANYWHERE. OTHER UROLOGY TREATMENTS AVAILABLE AT MCCH INCLUDE: -PEDIATRIC UROLOGY -UROLOGIC ONCOLOGY (CANCER) -PROSTATE CONDITIONS -MALE INFERTILITY -CALCULI (URINARY TRACT STONES) -FEMALE UROLOGY (URINARY INCONTINENCE AND PELVIC OUTLET RELAXATION DISORDERS) -NEUROUROLOGY (VOIDING DISORDERS, URODYNAMIC EVALUATION OF PATIENTS, AND ERECTILE DYSFUNCTION OR IMPOTENCE). THE SPECIALTY OF UROLOGY IS CONSTANTLY CHANGING. AS ADVANCES ARE MADE IN THE TREATMENT OF UROLOGIC CONDITIONS, MCCH WILL BE AMONG THE FIRST TO MAKE THESE NEW TREATMENTS AVAILABLE TO ITS PATIENTS.

OPHTHALMOLOGY: MCCH'S TEAM OF EYE CARE SURGEONS PROVIDES SURGICAL CARE TO CORRECT AN ARRAY OF VISION PROBLEMS. MOST CATARACT AND OTHER EYE SURGERIES CAN BE DONE ON AN OUTPATIENT BASIS. SURGERIES OF THE EYE INCLUDE: -CATARACT/IMPLANT SURGERY -GLAUCOMA SURGERY -REFRACTIVE/LASER SURGERY ORTHOPEDICS AND TOTAL JOINT REPLACEMENTS: MCCH'S TEAM OF ORTHOPEDIC SURGEONS PROVIDES JOINT REPLACEMENT AND OTHER ORTHOPEDIC RELATED SURGERY CARE. THESE SURGERIES INCLUDE A FULL RANGE OF HIP REPLACEMENTS, KNEE REPLACEMENTS, AND SURGERIES RELATED TO MINOR OR MODERATE TRAUMA AND REPETITIVE WORK INJURIES. MCCH'S NEW SURGICAL SUITES PROVIDE A FACILITY SPECIFIC FOR ORTHOPEDIC AND JOINT REPLACEMENT PROCEDURES. AFTER SURGERY, PATIENTS CAN STAY RIGHT THERE AT MCCH TO TAKE ADVANTAGE OF THEIR OUTSTANDING PHYSICAL THERAPY SERVICES. THERE IS NO NEED TO TRAVEL TO RECEIVE FOLLOW UP CARE. MCCH'S COMPLETE INPATIENT AND OUTPATIENT REHAB SERVICES WILL GET A PATIENT MOVING AGAIN AS QUICKLY AS POSSIBLE. ENDOSCOPY PROCEDURES: ENDOSCOPY PROCEDURES CAN BE COMPLETED ON AN INPATIENT OR OUTPATIENT BASIS, DEPENDING ON THE DIAGNOSIS OR TREATMENT NEEDED. PROCEDURES PERFORMED IN MCCH'S TWO NEWLY-REMODELED ENDOSCOPY ROOMS INCLUDE: -CYSTOSCOPY - TO DIAGNOSE DISEASES OF THE BLADDER AND URETHRA -SYGMOIDOSCOPY AND COLONOSCOPY - TO DIAGNOSE AND TREAT DISEASES OF THE COLON -ESOPHOGOGASTRODUODENOSCOPY (EGD) - TO DIAGNOSE DISEASES OF THE STOMACH, ESOPHAGUS AND SMALL INTESTINE -BRONCHOSCOPY - TO DIAGNOSE DISEASES OF THE TRACHEA AND LUNGS OTHER MINOR SURGICAL PROCEDURES ARE COMPLETED USING ENDOSCOPY, INCLUDING THE EXCISION OF LESIONS AND SKIN BIOPSIES. THE MATERNITY CENTER: BEING A MOTHER STARTS LONG BEFORE A BABY IS BORN. THE MOTHER HAS GOT LOTS OF DECISIONS TO MAKE, LIKE THE BABY'S NAME OR WHAT COLOR TO PAINT THE NURSERY. THE MATERNITY CENTER AT MCCH CAN HELP WITH THE ONE CHOICE THE MOTHER CAN'T AFFORD NOT TO MAKE: HAVING THE BEST CARE POSSIBLE. THE PATIENT'S BABY DESERVES THE BEST OF EVERYTHING, AND THE RIGHT PRENATAL CARE CAN MAKE ALL THE DIFFERENCE IN THE WORLD. AT THE MATERNITY CENTER, THE PATIENT CAN CONCENTRATE ON THE EXCITEMENT OF THEIR PREGNANCY, KNOWING THE PATIENT AND THE PATIENT'S NEW BABY ARE IN THE BEST OF HANDS. THE MOTHER EXPERIENCES THE JOY OF CHILDBIRTH, FROM LABOR AND DELIVERY TO RECOVERY AND POST-PARTUM, IN ONE OF MCCH'S THREE BEAUTIFULLY DECORATED BIRTHING SUITES. THESE LARGE, ATTRACTIVE ROOMS OFFER PRIVATE BATHS, SHOWERS, AND OVERNIGHT ACCOMMODATIONS FOR A LOVED ONE. THE MATERNITY CENTER AT MCCH: -PERSONAL TOURS -CHILDBIRTH EDUCATION -INFANT CARE EDUCATION -UNIVERSAL HEARING TESTS -PRENATAL NUTRITIONAL COUNSELING PRENATAL CLINIC: THE PRENATAL CLINIC IS PART OF OBSTETRICS & GYNECOLOGY OF LONDON, INC. AND HELPS TO PROVIDE CARE TO WOMEN WHO WOULD OTHERWISE BE UNABLE TO PAY FOR PRENATAL CARE. DR. MITCHELL SPAHN AND DR. JENNIFER POWELL, BOARD CERTIFIED OB/GYNS, ALONG WITH THEIR CARING STAFF OF PROFESSIONALS, PROVIDE OBSTETRICAL CARE FOR PATIENTS. THE CLINIC PROVIDES PRENATAL CARE AND COUNSELING SERVICES CHARGED ON A SLIDING FEE SCALE. SOME SERVICES, INCLUDING FREE PREGNANCY TESTS, ARE PROVIDED AT MCCH. A CLINIC EDUCATOR ANSWERS QUESTIONS AND EDUCATES FUTURE MOTHERS ABOUT WHAT TO EXPECT DURING PREGNANCY, BODY CHANGES, AND OTHER ISSUES RELATED TO PRENATAL CARE. PATIENTS HAVE UNLIMITED ACCESS DURING PREGNANCY TO A DIETICIAN AND LICENSED SOCIAL WORKER SPECIALIZING IN PRENATAL CARE. CLINIC STAFF CAN ALSO MAKE REFERRALS IF NECESSARY. COMMUNITY EDUCATION AND OUTREACH: EVERY FAMILY HAS DIFFERENT NEEDS AND INTERESTS. THAT'S WHY MCCH OFFERS FREE OUTREACH PROGRAMS FOR AREA RESIDENTS OF ALL AGES, SCHOOLS AND COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS. TOPICS INCLUDE SUBSTANCE ABUSE AND HEALTH MANAGEMENT. CONSUMER HEALTH LIBRARY & CANCER RESOURCE CENTER: MCCH OFFERS A HEALTH LIBRARY WITH A BROAD SPECTRUM OF INFORMATION FOR AREA RESIDENTS. IT IS LOCATED IN THE HOSPITAL CAFETERIA AND OPEN TO THE PUBLIC. RESIDENTS ARE INVITED TO READ AND/OR CHECK OUT LIBRARY BOOKS. A VIDEO LENDING LIBRARY IS ALSO AVAILABLE THROUGH THE EDUCATION DIRECTOR AT EXT. 7321. A VARIETY OF EDUCATIONAL BROCHURES ON HEALTH-RELATED TOPICS ARE AVAILABLE AT NO CHARGE. THE HOSPITAL ALSO OFFERS AN EDUCATIONAL ONLINE LIBRARY AT WWW.MADISONCOUNTYHOSPITAL.ORG. SEARCH THE MYHEALTH LIBRARY FOR CURRENT ARTICLES ABOUT HEALTH AND WELLNESS, HEALTH CALCULATORS AND MORE. YOUTH SERVICES: MCCH OFFERS YOUTH SERVICES THROUGH THE HOSPITAL'S COMMUNITY EDUCATION AND PREVENTION DEPARTMENT. THESE SERVICES INCLUDE: -LIFE SKILLS -ANGER MANAGEMENT -DEALING WITH GRIEF AND LOSS -DRUG AND ALCOHOL ADDICTION EDUCATION AND PREVENTION PROJECT TOP: PROJECT TOP, TIME OUT FOR PREVENTION, FOCUSES ON PRESCHOOL AND PRIMARY SCHOOL-AGED CHILDREN. PROJECT TOP ADDRESS ISSUES LIKE ABSTAINING FROM THE USE OF ALCOHOL, TOBACCO AND DRUGS, SAFETY, SELF-ESTEEM, AND UNDERSTANDING DIFFERENT EMOTIONS AND HOW TO DEAL WITH THEM. EMERGENCY PREPAREDNESS: MCCH IS AN INTEGRAL PARTNER IN COMMUNITY AND REGIONAL EMERGENCY PLANNING. THE HOSPITAL PARTICIPATES IN THE CENTRAL OHIO TRAUMA SYSTEM'S REGIONAL HOSPITAL EMERGENCY PLANNING COMMITTEE AS WELL AS THE LOCAL EMERGENCY PLANNING COMMITTEE. EXERCISES ARE PERFORMED IN COOPERATION WITH LOCAL FIRE, EMS AND LAW ENFORCEMENT AGENCIES. THE HOSPITAL ALSO PARTICIPATES IN REGIONAL EMERGENCY PREPAREDNESS DRILLS. MCCH STOCKPILES DISASTER SUPPLIES AND EQUIPMENT INCLUDING A THREE LANE DECONTAMINATION SHELTER. SUPPORT GROUPS: SOMETIMES SCHOOL CHILDREN NEED TO TALK ABOUT THEIR PROBLEMS OR FEARS. THE MCCH COMMUNITY EDUCATION DEPARTMENT OFFERS SUPPORT GROUPS FOR STUDENTS ADDRESSING A WIDE RANGE OF ISSUES: SMOKING CESSATION, LOSS/GRIEF COUNSELING, SELF-ESTEEM, PEER RELATIONS AND OTHER TOPICS AS REQUESTED BY SCHOOL ADMINISTRATION. THESE SUPPORT GROUPS ARE AVAILABLE TO ANY STUDENT. PARENTS MAY REQUEST THEIR CHILD BE PLACED IN A SPECIFIC GROUP. CPR CLASSES: CPR CLASSES AVAILABLE THROUGH MCCH INCLUDE: -BASIC LIFE SUPPORT FOR HEALTH CARE PROVIDERS -CPR PROGRAM FOR HEALTH CARE PROFESSIONALS -HEART SAVER CPR PROGRAM FOR COMMUNITY GROUPS

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990, SCHEDULE D, PART XII AND XIII
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE REPORT ON AUDITS OF CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS IS PREPARED ON BEHALF OF THE MADISON COUNTY HOSPITAL, INC. AND AFFILIATES (MADISON COUNTY COMMUNITY HOSPITAL, INC. AND MADISON COUNTY HOSPITAL FOUNDATION, INC.) THE DISCLOSURE IN PARTS XII AND XIII REPRESENTS THE SEPARATE COMPANY ACTIVITY OF THE MADISON COUNTY COMMUNITY HOSPITAL AS PRESENTED IN THE STATEMENTS AND SUPPLEMENTAL SCHEDULES.
